A mantra consists of uniquely selected special syllables.

Each mantra carries a certain amount of positive vibration, which when repeated regularly over a period of time can generate positive emotions, peace of mind and bestow oneself with sound health.

 This app allows you to add your personal list of mantras, with each Mantra having a definite amount of chants/goal to be completed. It also allows you to keep a track of the chants/malas completed.

A Mala is a sacred rosary in the form of a garland used for keeping count while reciting, chanting, or mentally repeating a mantra or the name of a deity. This sādhanā (practice) is known in Sanskrit as Japa. Malas are typically made with 18, 27, 54 or 108 beads.

According to Vedas (Ancient India Text), the details of the recommended amount of Japa required for a Mantra in the current epoch is given below.
 
 ⦿ Chants - 1,25,000
 ⦿ Hawan - 12,500 
 ⦿ Tarpan - 1,250
 ⦿ Maarjan - 125
 ⦿ Brahman Bhoj - 13

As an alternative, instead of performing above activities, we can perform chants equivalent to the combined total of all the above amounts, which approximately turns out to be 1,38,888. And, in order to nullify the effect of any erroneous chants, it is recommended to add some buffer amount to the sum and make it a total of 1,50,000.


Now, if we consider an ideal Japa Mala to consist of 108 beads, we are required to complete a total of 1,500 Malas in order to reach an ideal chanting goal for any Mantra.
